'''Andwise "Andy" Roper''' was a [[Hobbits|Hobbit]] of [[the Shire]].

==History==
Andwise was the son of [[Hobson|Hobson "Roper" Gamgee]], an older brother of [[Gaffer Gamgee|Hamfast Gamgee]]. Whereas his brother became a gardener, Andwise inherited the family [[Wikipedia:ropewalk|rope-walk]] in [[Tighfield]], and continued the family trade.<ref name=taming>{{TT|Taming}}</ref> He left his ropewalk to his son [[Anson Roper|Anson]] after his death, founding the [[Roper family]].<ref name="Gamgee">{{App|Gamgee}}</ref> 

[[Sam Gamgee]], seeing how the [[Elves]] used ropes to cross the [[Silverlode]] in [[Lothlórien]], said that not even his "Uncle Andy" did those tricks.<ref>{{FR|Lorien}}</ref> Later he mentioned him and Hobson as an example that to know about ropes and knots is "in the family".<ref name=taming/>

==Etymology==
The name comes from [[Old English]] ''andwīs'' which means "expert, skilful".<ref>{{HM|IE}}, "Giving of Names"</ref>
